page.title: 18LOWER RIVINGTON RESERVOIR
page.content: An aerial photograph of the block would show the reservoir covering a large area in the north east. It was created in 1847 in a quest for clean drinking water by the health conscious Liverpool Corporation. The natural basin and the hard gritstone hills provided a natural site. Nowadays the natural beauty of the reservoir has lent itself to growing leisure use.One photograph shows the activity of the local sailing school, whilst the fishermen meet at Rivington village at the head of the water. On the west bank of the reservoir lies Tan Pits Farm which is the local headquarters of the Conservation Volunteers Trust.They stock a vast, varied nursery at the farm and the fruits of their work can be seen in the plantations of rowan and beech, as well as in the reclaimed lakes below.
